---
title: "Monitoring Visit Types"
---

## Overview
Monitoring visits are conducted at defined intervals to evaluate site
performance and trial compliance.

## Visit Types

### Pre-Study Visit (PSV)
**Purpose**
- Assess site suitability
- Confirm infrastructure and staff readiness

**CRA Focus**
- Source documentation systems
- Pharmacy and lab capabilities
- Staff availability and experience

---

### Site Initiation Visit (SIV)
**Purpose**
- Train site staff
- Confirm readiness to enroll

**CRA Focus**
- Protocol training documentation
- Delegation of Authority (DOA)
- EDC access and training

---

### Interim Monitoring Visit (IMV)
**Purpose**
- Ongoing oversight during trial conduct

**CRA Focus**
- Source Data Verification (SDV)
- Informed consent compliance
- Safety reporting
- Protocol deviations

---

### For-Cause Visit
**Purpose**
- Address identified risks or noncompliance

**Triggers**
- Repeated deviations
- Data quality concerns
- Safety signal escalation

---

### Close-Out Visit (COV)
**Purpose**
- Ensure trial completion and documentation readiness

**CRA Focus**
- IP reconciliation
- Data query resolution
- Document archiving
